ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Subject's gender OTHER describe
Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: Staff code number of person completing this form
Notes: 999= Missing Data

ElementDescription: Is English your first language?
Notes: 0 = No;  1 = Yes; 999 = Prefer not to respond

ElementDescription: Were there any validity issues?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Current: Auditory Hallucination: Frequency
Notes: 0 = Not present; 1 = Less than once a week; 2 = At least once a week; 3 = At least once a day; 4 = Continuous or almost continuous

ElementDescription: Past: Auditory Hallucination: Frequency
Notes: 0 = Not present; 1 = Less than once a week; 2 = At least once a week; 3 = At least once a day; 4 = Continuous or almost continuous

ElementDescription: Current: Auditory Hallucination: Duration
Notes: 0 = Not present; 1 = A few seconds; 2 = Several minutes; 3 = At least one hour; 4 = For hours at a time

ElementDescription: Past: Auditory Hallucination: Duration
Notes: 0 = Not present; 1 = A few seconds; 2 = Several minutes; 3 = At least one hour; 4 = For hours at a time

ElementDescription: Current: Auditory Hallucination: Intensity/Loudness
Notes: 0 = Not present; 1 = Quieter than participant's own voice; 2 = About same loudness as participant's voice; 3 = Somewhat louder than participant's voice; 4 = Extremely loud (e.g., shouting)

ElementDescription: Past: Auditory Hallucination: Intensity/Loudness
Notes: 0 = Not present; 1 = Quieter than participant's own voice; 2 = About same loudness as participant's voice; 3 = Somewhat louder than participant's voice; 4 = Extremely loud (e.g., shouting)

ElementDescription: Current: Auditory Hallucination: Complexity
Notes: 0 = Not present; 1 = Simple, meaningless sounds; 2 = Word-like sounds, simple melody, or wordless meaningful sounds (e.g., laughter), or coherent/isolated nonhuman sound (e.g., whistle); 3 = Words, short phrases, or parts of songs; 4 = Complete sentences, songs, or multiple voices conversing

ElementDescription: Past: Auditory Hallucination: Complexity
Notes: 0 = Not present; 1 = Simple, meaningless sounds; 2 = Word-like sounds, simple melody, or wordless meaningful sounds (e.g., laughter), or coherent/isolated nonhuman sound (e.g., whistle); 3 = Words, short phrases, or parts of songs; 4 = Complete sentences, songs, or multiple voices conversing

ElementDescription: Current: Auditory Hallucination: Interference with other sounds
Notes: 0 = Not present; 1 = No interference; 2 = Mild; 3 = Moderate; 4 = Severe interference (e.g., unable to follow a conversation)

ElementDescription: Past: Auditory Hallucination: Interference with other sounds
Notes: 0 = Not present; 1 = No interference; 2 = Mild; 3 = Moderate; 4 = Severe interference (e.g., unable to follow a conversation)

ElementDescription: Current: Auditory Hallucination: Interruption of Thought Processes/Concentration
Notes: 0 = Not present; 1 = No concentration difficulties; 2 = Mild; 3 = Moderate; 4 = Unable to concentrate on anything else during auditory hallucinations

ElementDescription: Past: Auditory Hallucination: Interruption of Thought Processes/Concentration
Notes: 0 = Not present; 1 = No concentration difficulties; 2 = Mild; 3 = Moderate; 4 = Unable to concentrate on anything else during auditory hallucinations

ElementDescription: Current: Auditory Hallucination: Frequency of Control
Notes: 0 = Not present; 1 = Participant always feels some type of control; 2 = More than half the time can control; 3 = Less than half the time can control; 4 = Never able to control

ElementDescription: Past: Auditory Hallucination: Frequency of Control
Notes: 0 = Not present; 1 = Participant always feels some type of control; 2 = More than half the time can control; 3 = Less than half the time can control; 4 = Never able to control

ElementDescription: If auditory hallucination frequency of control is rated 1, 2, or 3, then what about the experience does the individual feel they can control? (circle all that apply)
Notes: 1 = Frequency, 2 = Duration; 3 = Intensity; 4 = Other (specify)

ElementDescription: If auditory hallucination frequency of control is rated 1, 2, or 3, then what about the experience does the individual feel they can control? (circle all that apply), Other: specify
Is there anything you do to cope with these auditory hallucinations?
Current: Auditory Hallucination: Attentional Demand
Notes: 0 = Not present; 1 = Easy to ignore; 2 = Moderate difficulty ignoring; 3 = Difficult to ignore; 4 = Unable to ignore

ElementDescription: Past: Auditory Hallucination: Attentional Demand
Notes: 0 = Not present; 1 = Easy to ignore; 2 = Moderate difficulty ignoring; 3 = Difficult to ignore; 4 = Unable to ignore

ElementDescription: Current: Auditory Hallucination: Amount of Negative Content
Notes: 0 = Not present; 1 = No unpleasant/negative content; 2 = Minority (less than half) of contents are unpleasant/negative; 3 = Majority but not all of contents are unpleasant/negative (more than half the time); 4 = All of contents are unpleasant or negative

ElementDescription: Past: Auditory Hallucination: Amount of Negative Content
Notes: 0 = Not present; 1 = No unpleasant/negative content; 2 = Minority (less than half) of contents are unpleasant/negative; 3 = Majority but not all of contents are unpleasant/negative (more than half the time); 4 = All of contents are unpleasant or negative

ElementDescription: Current: Auditory Hallucination: Degree of Negative Content (Rater's Judgment)
Notes: 0 = Not present; 1 = No unpleasant or negative content; 2 = Mild (may include vaguely morbid or violent comments); 3 = Moderate (may include explicit morbid or violent comments); 4 = Severe (Contents perceived as threatening, excessively morbid, or violent)

ElementDescription: Past: Auditory Hallucination: Degree of Negative Content (Rater's Judgment)
Notes: 0 = Not present; 1 = No unpleasant or negative content; 2 = Mild (may include vaguely morbid or violent comments); 3 = Moderate (may include explicit morbid or violent comments); 4 = Severe (Contents perceived as threatening, excessively morbid, or violent)

ElementDescription: Check if auditory hallucination content is definitively pleasant
Notes: 0 = Not checked; 1 = Checked

ElementDescription: Current: Auditory Hallucination: Frequency of Negative emotion Associated with Hallucination
Notes: 0 = Not present; 1 = Never distressed; 2 = Distressed less than half the time; 3 = Distressed more than half the time; 4 = Always distressed

ElementDescription: Past: Auditory Hallucination: Frequency of Negative emotion Associated with Hallucination
Notes: 0 = Not present; 1 = Never distressed; 2 = Distressed less than half the time; 3 = Distressed more than half the time; 4 = Always distressed

ElementDescription: Current: Auditory Hallucination: Intensity of negative emotional Impact
Notes: 0 = Not present; 1 = Not distressing; 2 = Somewhat distressing; 3 = Very distressing; 4 = Extremely distressing (worst participant could possibly feel)

ElementDescription: Past: Auditory Hallucination: Intensity of negative emotional Impact
Notes: 0 = Not present; 1 = Not distressing; 2 = Somewhat distressing; 3 = Very distressing; 4 = Extremely distressing (worst participant could possibly feel)
